thread.title: North Philly rapper GrandeMarshall announces new album, single
thread.title_full: North Philly rapper GrandeMarshall announces new album, single

author: Allie Volpe
title: North Philly rapper GrandeMarshall announces new album, single
text:
Entertainment North Philly rapper GrandeMarshall announces new album, single Fool's Gold Records rapper GrandeMarshall has been plugging his upcoming album My Brother's Keeper for over a year now, releasing tracks since last summer. The only thing missing was a release date. North Philly rapper GrandeMarshall announces new album, single GrandeMarshall, who hails from Philadelphia, will release his upcoming album, "My Brother's Keeper" on Nov. 20. Photo via Instagram Travel Deals Allie Volpe Posted: Monday, October 26, 2015, 3:21 PM 
Fool’s Gold Records rapper GrandeMarshall has been plugging his upcoming album My Brother’s Keeper for over a year now, releasing tracks since last summer. The only thing missing was a release date. 
My Brother’s Keeper now has an official release date — November 20 — and shiny new single to go along with it. 
The North Philly rapper released “Never Change,” a confident, humming track today via The Fader boasting his authenticity as an artist and a human. Give it a listen below. 
It’s been two years since GrandeMarshall’s sophomore mixtape Mugga Man , released in 2013 when he was just 19. The young artist also made appearances at Austin’s SXSW music festival in 2013 and 2014. 
No tour dates are scheduled as of yet.
